description: A chronic inflammatory condition of the gastrointestinal tract with unknown specific etiopathogenesis.
A biologic drug used to treat inflammatory bowel disease by inhibiting tumor necrosis factor α.
A family of enzymes that transmit signals within cells and are implicated in various immune responses.
Receptors involved in lymphocyte trafficking and various aspects of the immune response.
Signaling molecules that mediate and regulate immunity, inflammation, and hematopoiesis.
A type of white blood cell that plays a vital role in the immune response.
A group of immune cells involved in the maintenance of tissue homeostasis and immune responses.
